intro: Cymopterus glaber, commonly known as the nakedleaf lomatium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually small and white or pale yellow, and it produces a distinctive, aromatic seed head. Cymopterus glaber is often found in sagebrush steppe and woodland areas, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
